{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3521390,"name":"James","username":"JamerGamer789","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-09T15:47:49.605Z","cooked":"

Our VH-109 radio has the latest firmware, but we are having trouble connecting to it. All lights are solid except for the 2.4 GHz light, which we have the dip switch in the on position for. We can’t even connect to it over ethernet. I tried to use the Vivid Hosting tool to connect to it, and it is able to configure my ethernet 5 connection but unable to pull up the config webpage. We are powering it over POE with the PDH and a 10 amp breaker.

This is also one of the newer batches of radios. Any help would be appreciated!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-09T15:47:49.605Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":68,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":363.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":490885,"topic_slug":"vh-109-radio-no-connection","display_username":"James","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51278,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vh-109-radio-no-connection/490885/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3521701,"name":"Alex Tsekhansky","username":"atsekhan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/0ea827/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-09T23:20:48.310Z","cooked":"

What do you see on the FRC Driver Station, console log when you turn the robot ON?
You will see some messages when the robot starts, some are related to the radio and they have important information. So, post them here

I don’t have connection to the radio over WiFi or ethernet, so how can I see what the FRC Driver Station says when turn the robot on? We subbed in one of the old white radios and connecting to the robot works just fine.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-09T23:51:46.961Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":78,"readers_count":77,"score":20.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":490885,"topic_slug":"vh-109-radio-no-connection","display_username":"James","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":50762,"username":"atsekhan","name":"Alex Tsekhansky","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/0ea827/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51278,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vh-109-radio-no-connection/490885/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3521792,"name":"Alex Tsekhansky","username":"atsekhan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/0ea827/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-10T00:52:58.681Z","cooked":"

Meaning - you do not see its SSID at all?

The SSID should be FRC-999 by default. If you do not see it, most likely you did not set DIP switches right. The switch 3 should be ON and all others should be OFF as far as I remember (or vise versa - you can try one of these two combinations and it should work).

Make sure that radio is pugged into the right port as well.
